    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelSelector

        LevelSelector()

      • LevelSelector

        LevelSelector(int level)
        Constructor method of the level worlds. Creates the screen based on Options.screenWidth and Options.screenHeight (see Options class) world has a cellsize of 1 pixel and isn't bounded (bounded meaning we can spawn blocks past the screen border like say x -10 or x 5819291
        Parameters:
        level - pass on what level the game should be loading the player at, basically if this is set to 1 the player will load on the first level node, if 15 they will load on the 15th. spares you a bit of walking when in later levels ;)

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Act method called every frame to scroll the camera as long as the death condition isn't met.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.World

      • getSelectedLevel

        static int getSelectedLevel()
        Returns the currently selected level
        Returns:
        return currently selected level as int

      • setSelectedLevel

        static void setSelectedLevel(int input)
        Sets the current selected level
        Parameters:
        input - sets the current selected level to this

      • renderLocks

        private void renderLocks()
        Render the locks over levels which are not yet unlocked. does this for all 15 levels by checking Globals.levelsUnlocked vs what index it's at.

      • getLevelX

        static double getLevelX(int level)
        Simple method to return the tile location of the level, hardcoded. tiny bit increased for the offset we want the SelectorPlayer to have when calling this method
        Parameters:
        level - Pass on what level it should get the X value off
        Returns:
        returns the X value as the tile location (needs to be scaled up elsewhere)

      • getLevelY

        static double getLevelY(int level)
        Simple method to return the tile location of the level, hardcoded. tiny bit increased for the offset we want the SelectorPlayer to have when calling this method
        Parameters:
        level - Pass on what level it should get the Y value off
        Returns:
        returns the Y value as the tile location (needs to be scaled up elsewhere)

      • spawnCamera

        private void spawnCamera()
        Simple method to spawn the camera and update it to the player's position background is just given because the camera was coded that way... will need a rework later for use without background.

      • scroll

        private void scroll()
        Collects information on how far the camera should scroll and then scrolls by that much only moves when set barrier is crossed to create a deadzone in the center that doesn't scroll this makes the camera a bit nicer as it isn't as annoying might want to add a bit of drag later to this. loX (low X) = barrier left of center hiX (high X) = barrier right of center loY (low Y) = barrier above the center hiY (high Y) = barrier below the center calls up camera.scroll with resulted dsx and dsy to scroll by those cords relative to current camera position

      • getMap

        private static int[][] getMap()
        Method that reads a file and based on that returns a 2 dimensional array later to be used when rendering the map Unlike Levels.java this one has no arguments because it will always load the same map
        Returns:
        returns 2 dimensional array as [layer][ID]

      • renderMap

        private void renderMap(int[][] worldMap,
                       int level,
                       int playerLayer)
        Method used to render the actual map into the game based on a 2 dimensional array
        Parameters:
        worldMap - Expects a 2 dimensional array which holds all layers and their values. used to render the world
        level - Tells the player on what node it has to be rendered.
        playerLayer - When the layer that is being rendered is equal to this the player gets added at the end of rendering this layer

      • Add

        private void Add(greenfoot.Actor nextBlock,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Method used to add a block/tile/object into the map based on the X,Y of the tile this x,y will then be sized up to be equals to the Options.blockSize
        Parameters:
        nextBlock - actor for what block should be placed
        width - x coordinate for where the block should be placed
        height - y coordinate for where the block should be placed
